Description: Small marl pottery jar with flat base expanding to wide shoulder, with direct lip rim and three pierced triangular lug handles on the shoulder; decorated with wavy lines ‘festoons’, two lines of solid triangles and a bush motif. Paint has been applied to the handles and a single line is painted across the base.
Curator's comments: Predynastic Decorated ware of Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Three wavy lines encircle the shoulder below the rim, hanging down from them are two wavy line festoons, one encircling one of the handles. One the body are two rows of solid triangles (usually interpreted as mountains), and one fan-shaped bush motif. Paint is irregularly applied. Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 215.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
